subject: Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The Islanders finally found free agents willing to join them, signing the All-Star forward Bill Guerin to a two-year contract and center Mike Comrie to a one-year deal. Guerin, a four-time All-Star, scored 36 goals last season while splitting time between St. Louis and San Jose. He joins a team that lost forwards Ryan Smyth, Jason Blake, Richard Zednik, Viktor Kozlov and defenseman Tom Poti since the free-agent signing period began Sunday. Comrie had 20 goals and 25 assists with Ottawa.
